mxCell.value:
I am Zarbalatrax, King of Shadow Time.
Tell me, what do you fear?
Ahh, I see. The paradox of the dark. Either something is there, or it is not. Tell me, are you brave?
To be alone is to face your true self. Tell me, do you like what you see?
The Beast. I don't blame you. Tell me, do you fear possession of yourself or a loved one?
You wake up bound to a chair. The room is pitch black. Your eyes struggle to process the dark.
Give up. It's not worth it.

You fight and thrash violently, but your bonds hold strong. The chair rocks, and you lose your balance.

Crash!

You hit the cold, damp stone. You hit your head, a dull noise spilling into your vision.

You swear, the sound echoes subtly.

"Why so vulguar?" a scratchy voice mocks.

The creature laughs at you.

"What a pathetic, lothesome creature. I like your attitude. You thrashed so hard I thought you might actually put up a fight."

Footsteps crash in rhythm. Closer. Closer.

It's standing above you, a dominating presence. It snaps it's fingers. A candle flickers on in front of you. The beast stands over you, breathing heavy.

"Oh, you sweet, beautiful fool."

The creatures face is but inches from yours, now. Its horrible grin stretches inhumanly. It's eyes, hollow and sunken.

"You will make a nice addition to my collection."

A sharp pain in your neck. You've been stabbed.

It continues hacking and chopping. You perish quickly.

Your face now floats in pieces in one of the beast's many jars.

Sometimes, you must take action when you most want to succumb.

Welcome back.
It seems your fate brought you back here.
Tell me, what do you fear?

"Ah! So you do have some fight left! That is more like it."

The creature pulls out a long, sharp knife.

It cuts you free, and helps you up.

You scramble to your feet, and tear off into the dark. Within moments, you smash into an opposing wall.

You trace the wall.

The creature cackles. It echoes around the room.

The stone wall becomes wood. A heavy door.

You pull on the handle, it's locked.

You slam and pound on the door with your entire body, screaming and begging for someone on the other side to open it.

Soon, your body aches, you grow tired. Nobody is coming. You slip down the face of the door, and land on the ground, exhausted.

The creature is still on the other side of the room, barely illuminated by candle light.

You've been splattered against the wooden door.

Doors that you thought were open to you may no longer be. Check, before they're locked.
"What a pathetic and horrible suggestion, to sacrifice an innocent for yourself? To waste such potential? To think I'd want a baby, instead of your supple flesh?".

"You will make a nice addition to my collection."

A sharp pain in your neck. You've been stabbed.

It continues hacking and chopping. You perish quickly.

Your face now floats in pieces in one of the beast's many jars.

Sometimes, you must take action when you most want to succumb.
"Your blood... yes. This I can accept. Come with me, I have something to show you."
"I have no interest in material objects. Such things mean nothing to me. It's you, that I want."

"You will make a nice addition to my collection."

A sharp pain in your neck. You've been stabbed.

It continues hacking and chopping. You perish quickly.

Your face now floats in pieces in one of the beast's many jars.

Sometimes, you must take action when you most want to succumb.

"What are you?" You ask.

The creature's hand remains locked tight around your arm.

"I am the Zagnar, The Gatekeeper."
The creature's hand remains locked tight around your arm.
"There is something I need you to do."
Within moments, the creature has drawn a knife, and decapitated you. You die instantly.

Your face now floats in pieces in one of the beast's many jars.

Sometimes, you must take action when you most want to succumb.

"My, my, so full of vigor you are."

Footsteps crash in rhythm. Closer. Closer.

It's standing above
you, a dominating presence. It snaps it's fingers. A candle flickers on
in front of you. The beast stands over you, breathing heavy.

The creatures face is but inches from yours, now. Its horrible grin stretches inhumanly. It's eyes, hollow and sunken.

The creature pulls out a long, sharp knife.

It cuts you free, and helps you up.

It hands you it's gnarled blade.

"I am Zagnar, the Gatekeeper. I will grant your wish, raise your blade."
You lie there, numb to your surroundings. Your vision starts to dance, as you see a fuzzy noise overcomes your vision.

Your breath slows. The dark breathes with you.

It starts to feel less scary, less lonely. It becomes like a blanket. The cold floor.

You lay for who knows how long. Time stretches and shrinks here, in the void.

You are calm, and peaceful, a sense of clarity overwhelms you.

Voices overwhelm you, revealing secrets of the universe.

Horrible, beautiful, a cacophony of emotions, empires rising and falling -- lies, betrayal, love, all at once!

Your third eye opens.

You become one with the dark. A primordial being. Some sort of fucked up god, cursed forever to bear witness to history and humanity, with no influence on it's outcome.

Cursed to know everything.

You fight tirelessly against your situation that moments ago you gave up on. Halfheartedly, you push back the darkness, not giving into it's incessant demands.

Voices whisper to you, begging you to let go, to be free, to let the darkness take you, but you continue to resist.

Days pass, but it feels like only moments. You're starving, for food and for stimulation.
